The notes are being  issued in two tranches with $1.4 billion due in 2024 and $1.8 billion due in  2044. The Rating Outlook is Stable. column5: TOKYO Mizuho Financial Group  looks likely to escape serious penalty in a loans-to-mobsters scandal after an outside panel said on Monday that Japan's second-biggest bank by assets did not intentionally try to hide the shady lending from investigators.

column4: Credit markets see Morgan Stanley as less risky than Goldman
column5: NEW YORK  Oct 28 Morgan Stanley is now seen in derivatives markets as less likely to default on its debt than Goldman Sachs  a reversal of long-term price trends that signals investors' confidence in the bank's efforts to make itself safer.

column4: Mosaic to buy CF's phosphate business for $1.2 billion
column5: Mosaic Co  said on Monday that it would buy the phosphate business of fellow U.S. fertilizer producer CF Industries Holdings Inc  for $1.2 billion in cash  in a deal that bolsters each company's core business.

column4: UPDATE 2-Mosaic to buy CF's phosphate business for $1.2 billion
column5: (Adds Mosaic interview  CF  shareholder comments  details)

column4: Mosaic share buyback plans not affected by CF deal -CFO
column5: Oct 28 Mosaic Co's plans to buy back shares will not be affected by the fertilizer company's agreement to buy the phosphate business of CF Industries Holdings Inc  Mosaic Chief Financial Officer Larry Stranghoener said on Monday.

column4: Mosaic to buy CF Industries' phosphate business for $1.2 bln
column5: Oct 28 U.S. fertilizer maker Mosaic Co  said it would buy CF Industries Holdings Inc's phosphate mining and manufacturing business for $1.2 billion in cash.

column4: UPDATE 2-Petrobras plans new Brazil fuel price system to cut debt
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  Oct 28 Brazil's state-run oil company Petrobras has proposed a new fuel-pricing plan  hoping to generate more cash and cut debt levels by improving the timing of gasoline and diesel price adjustments  Chief Financial Officer Almir Barbassa said on Monday.

column4: Petrobras says Abreu-Lima refinery 82 pct built
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO   Oct 28 The long-delayed Abreu e Lima oil refinery in northeastern Brazil is 82 percent built  Jose Carlos Cosenza  director of refining and supply for Brazil's state-run oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA   said on Monday.

column4: EMERGING MARKETS-Petrobras helps Brazil shares snap 3-day slump
column5: * Brazil Bovespa up 0.64 pct  Mexico IPC rises 0.42 pct      SAO PAULO  Oct 28 Brazilian stocks rose for the first session in four on Monday as shares of state-run oil producer Petrobras jumped on news the company is discussing a new fuel-pricing policy.     Mexico's IPC index gained for a second straight day  while Chile's bourse crept higher.     Brazil's benchmark Bovespa stock index gained 0.64 percent to 54 498.85.     Late on Friday  Petroleo Brasileiro SA  as Petrobras is offi

column4: Petrobras says Libra field costs will not delay other projects
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  Oct 28 The cost of developing the giant offshore Libra oil field will not delay other projects in the portfolio of Brazil's state-run oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA  Director of Exploration José Formigli Filho said on a phone conference on Monday.

column4: Belarus extends house arrest of Russian potash CEO
column5: MINSK  Oct 28 Belarus has extended by two months the detention of the chief executive of Russian potash giant Uralkali  who was arrested in August following the collapse of a sales cartel which infuriated Russia's small ally.

column4: Turkey asks U.S. to extend pricing on Raytheon missile bid: sources
column5: WASHINGTON Turkey has asked the United States to extend the pricing on Raytheon Co's Patriot missile defense system proposal  two sources familiar with the discussions told Reuters on Monday  a sign that Ankara is keeping its options open in case its talks with the preferred Chinese supplier fall through.

column4: Turkey asks U.S. to extend pricing on Raytheon missile bid -sources
column5: WASHINGTON  Oct 28 Turkey has asked the United States to extend the pricing on Raytheon Co's Patriot missile defense system proposal  two sources familiar with the discussions told Reuters on Monday  a sign that Ankara is keeping its options open in case its talks with the preferred Chinese supplier fall through.

column4: Statoil to build new platform to squeeze more from North Sea field
column5: OSLO Norway's Statoil  plans to build a new platform at its Snorre field in the North Sea to extract another 300 million barrels of oil and extend the project's lifetime to 2040  it said on Monday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Statoil to build new platform to squeeze more from North Sea field
column5: * To extract another 300 mln barrels of oil from Snorre field

column4: Profits fall as Brazil phone companies spend on new strategies
column5: SAO PAULO/RIO DE JANEIRO Brazilian telecom companies saw profits slip in the third quarter as sales growth flattened and costly turnaround efforts got little traction  according to a Reuters survey of analysts.

column4: Telefonica's chairman to meet Italian PM on Tuesday: source
column5: MADRID/ROME The chairman of Telecom Italia's key investor Telefonica is to meet with Italian prime minister Enrico Letta on Tuesday  a source with knowledge of the matter said.

column4: UPDATE 1-Telefonica's chairman to meet Italian PM on Tuesday-source
column5: (Adds meeting between Italy PM and Telecom Italia CEO  context)

column4: Telefonica's chairman to meet Italian PM on Tuesday: source
column5: MADRID/ROME The chairman of Telecom Italia's key investor Telefonica is to meet with Italian prime minister Enrico Letta on Tuesday  a source with knowledge of the matter said.

column4: UPDATE 1-Telefonica's chairman to meet Italian PM on Tuesday-source
column5: (Adds meeting between Italy PM and Telecom Italia CEO  context)

column4: EU asks Spain to change price proposal for Telefonica
column5: MADRID The European Commission has asked Spanish competition regulator the CNMC to withdraw or amend its proposal to set the prices at which Telefonica can sell broadband services on its network to other companies.

column4: REFILE-UPDATE 1-EU asks Spain to change price proposal for Telefonica
column5: MADRID  Oct 28 The European Commission has asked Spanish competition regulator the CNMC to withdraw or amend its proposal to set the prices at which Telefonica can sell broadband services on its network to other companies.

column4: Telefonica's Alierta to meet with Italian PM on Tuesday - source
column5: MADRID  Oct 28 Spain's Telefonica  Chairman Cesar Alierta will meet with Italian Prime Minister Enrico Letta on Tuesday in the midst of his company's drive to increase its influence in Telecom Italia  a source with knowledge of the matter said on Monday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Teva Pharm denies report CEO mulling resignation over rift
column5: JERUSALEM  Oct 28 Teva Pharmaceutical Industries  and Chief Executive Jeremy Levin denied an Israeli media report that Levin was considering resigning due to a rift with the company's board of directors.

column4: Consumer Reports pulls recommendation for Toyota Camry
column5: DETROIT Toyota Motor Corp's  reputation for quality took a hit on Monday when influential magazine Consumer Reports pulled its recommendation on three of the Japanese automaker's vehicles  including its popular flagship Camry sedan  due to poor crash test results.

column4: Consumer Reports pulls recommendation for Toyota Camry
column5: * Magazine drops Camry  Prius v  RAV4 after poor crash test scores

column4: BUSINESS-NEWS-SCHEDULE AT 0930 GMT / 5.30 AM ET
column5: LONDON - European shares rise towards fresh five-year highs  and the dollar is under pressure on a growing conviction that the U.S. Federal Reserve will leave its loose money policy in place at a meeting this week. (MARKETS-GLOBAL (WRAPUP 5)  expect by 1030 GMT/6.30 AM ET  by Richard Hubbard  650 words)

column4: Toyota keeps top spot in auto sales rankings  outselling GM  VW
column5: TOKYO Toyota Motor Corp  kept its lead over rivals General Motors Co  and Volkswagen AG  this year  January-September global sales figures showed  as the Japanese carmaker closes in on a record annual profit.

column4: UPDATE 1-JPMorgan Chase hires U.S. Bank's Boardman as wealth CEO
column5: NEW YORK  Oct 28 JPMorgan Chase & Co.  has hired Michael Boardman to run banking  financial planning and investment management services for clients who do not qualify for its premier asset management and private banking services.

column4: Why Wells Fargo's loan losses are plunging
column5: Wells Fargo & Co's  loan book is performing better than many of its peers and better than even the bank expected in the middle of the last year  thanks to factors including higher house prices and tougher loan standards.

column4: Local tastes tempt China diners away from Golden Arches
column5: SHANGHAI Bearing rice burgers and lotus roots  an army of Chinese fast food firms is cooking up a challenge to McDonald's Corp and Yum Brands Inc  tempting cost-conscious diners with healthy  homegrown fare and causing a drag on growth for the U.S. chains in the country's $174 billion fast food market.
